# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + (length(line) > 0 ? 1 : 0) > text_width
            result *= line * "\n"
            line = word
        else
            if length(line) > 0
                line *= " "
            end
            line *= word
        end
    end
    result *= line
    return result
end

# Example 
println(wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."))
```

This function `wrap_string` takes a string input `text` and an optional `text_width` parameter with a default value of 10. It splits the text into words and iterates over them. If adding a new word would exceed the text width, it starts a new line. The example prints out the wrapped string.
